name: Standard Starting Position
description: The classical starting arrangement of pieces, foundation for every game.

name: Ruy López – Classical Setup
description: Position after 1.e4 e5 2.Nf3 Nc6 3.Bb5 – showcases central tension and pin on c6 knight.

name: Italian Game – Giuoco Pianissimo
description: Calm Italian structure ideal for learning slow build-ups (after 1.e4 e5 2.Nf3 Nc6 3.Bc4 Bc5 4.d3).

name: Sicilian Defence – Najdorf 6.Bg5
description: Sharp attacking setup common at every level; Black must know typical pawn breaks.

name: French Defence – Advance Variation
description: Classic pawn chain after 1.e4 e6 2.d4 d5 3.e5; great for learning space and breaks.

name: Caro-Kann – Short Variation
description: Solid structure highlighting minority attacks (after 1.e4 c6 2.d4 d5 3.Nc3 dxe4 4.Nxe4 Nf6 5.Nxf6+ exf6).

name: King's Gambit Accepted
description: Romantic opening where White sacrifices f-pawn for rapid development (1.e4 e5 2.f4 exf4).

name: Benko Gambit
description: Queenside pawn sacrifice for long-term activity (after 1.d4 Nf6 2.c4 c5 3.d5 b5).

name: London System Structure
description: Universal setup good for learners – solid pyramid and dark-square bishop on f4.

name: Queen's Gambit – Carlsbad Structure
description: Famous minority-attack pattern (…c6, …d5, White cxd5 exd5).

name: Stonewall Attack Setup
description: Characteristic pawn wall on d4-e3-f4-c3 with bishop on d3.

name: English Opening – Botvinnik Setup
description: Plans revolve around e2-e4 break; shows Hedgehog-style pawn formation.

name: Fool's Mate (Black to Move)
description: Shortest possible mate; teaches king safety (after 1.f3 e5 2.g4).

name: Scholar's Mate Threat
description: White threatens Qxf7# illustrating weak f7 square (after 1.e4 e5 2.Bc4 Nc6 3.Qh5).

name: Smothered Mate Pattern
description: Knight delivers mate while king is boxed by its own pieces.

name: Back-Rank Mate Setup
description: Exposes vulnerability of a king with no luft (lift).

name: Greek Gift Sacrifice
description: Classic Bxh7+ sacrifice attacking h-file (after typical French position).

name: Legall's Mate Breaking Point
description: Famous rapid-mate trick showing power of central knight fork.

name: Philidor Endgame – Lucena Position
description: Key rook endgame winning method (building a bridge).

name: Philidor Endgame – Philidor Draw
description: Defensive setup showing third-rank defence to draw pawn-up rook endgame.

name: Knight Fork – Classic Family Fork
description: Knight attacks king and queen simultaneously (learn fork geometry).

name: Pin – Absolute Pin Example
description: Pinned knight can't move without exposing king.

name: Skewer – Queen/King Skewer
description: Higher value piece forced to move exposing lower value one.

name: Zugzwang – Opposition King Endgame
description: Side to move is in trouble; ideal to practise key-square knowledge.

name: Boden's Mate Pattern
description: Cross-fire bishops mate an uncastled king.

name: Endgame – King and Pawn vs King (Winning)
description: Demonstrates king opposition and pawn promotion.

name: Endgame – King and Pawn vs King (Drawing)
description: Defender to move achieves opposition and draw.

name: Tarrasch Rule – Rook Behind Passed Pawn
description: Best placement for a rook supporting its own passed pawn.

name: Hedgehog Pawn Structure
description: Black's c-, d-, e-, a-, b-pawns; teaches patience and break timing.

name: Opposite-Side Castling Race
description: Both kings castled on opposite wings – launches pawn storms.

name: Scandinavian Defence – Main Line
description: Position after 1.e4 d5 2.exd5 Qxd5 3.Nc3 Qa5 – teaches queen activity & development tempo.

name: Pirc Defence – Classical Setup
description: Typical structure after 1.e4 d6 2.d4 Nf6 3.Nc3 g6 4.Nf3 Bg7.

name: Modern Defence – Tiger Fianchetto
description: Black invites large centre and counters with hyper-modern fianchetto.

name: Grünfeld Defence – Exchange Variation
description: Key pawn centre after 1.d4 Nf6 2.c4 g6 3.Nc3 d5 4.cxd5 Nxd5 5.e4 Nxc3 6.bxc3.

name: King's Indian – Mar del Plata
description: Razor-sharp opposite-wing attacks starting position.

name: Nimzo-Indian – Classical 4.Qc2
description: Illustrates hanging-pawn potential and bishop pair ideas.

name: Catalan – Closed Main Line
description: White's long-range bishop tests black's queenside setup.

name: Slav Defence – Meran Structure
description: Typical triangle pawn formation and minority-attack ideas.

name: Dutch Defence – Stonewall
description: Pawn wall d5-e6-f5 restricts centre; learn light-square strategy.

name: Alekhine Defence – Four Pawns Attack
description: White grabs space with four central pawns; black counter-punches.

name: Evans Gambit Accepted
description: Romantic pawn sacrifice in Italian Game (…Bxb4 4.c3 Ba5 5.d4).

name: Queen's Indian Defence – 4.g3
description: Hyper-modern fianchetto controlling light squares.

name: Petroff Defence – Classical
description: Symmetrical knights illustrate equality battle.

name: French Defence – Tarrasch 3.Nd2 c5
description: Isolated pawn themes and counter-attacks central tension.

name: Sicilian Dragon – Yugoslav 9.Bc4
description: Famous opposite-side castling attack race.

name: Sicilian – Sveshnikov Main
description: Dynamic e6-d6 structure and weak d5 square.

name: English Opening – Four Knights
description: Balanced development – good for positional manoeuvres.

name: Réti Opening – Kingside Fianchetto
description: Demonstrates flank development & central pressure.

name: Modern Benoni – Taimanov
description: Imbalanced pawn structure with e4/c4 vs d6/e6.

name: Queen's Gambit Accepted – Classical
description: Black gives c-pawn, aims for …c5 break.

name: Vienna Gambit – Main Line
description: Sharp pawn sacrifice leading to early piece activity.

name: Scotch Game – Mieses Variation
description: Open centre – perfect for tactical themes.

name: Semi-Tarrasch Defence
description: Isolated d-pawn framework demonstrates active piece play.

name: King's Gambit – Fischer Defence
description: Defensive system that neutralises King's Gambit while keeping pawn.

name: Sicilian Alapin – 2.c3
description: Anti-Sicilian line aiming for strong centre with d4.

name: Grob Attack – Early h4
description: Unorthodox line teaching punishment of premature wing advances.

name: Philidor Defence – Hanham
description: Solid but passive; shows cramped positions management.

name: Isolated Queen Pawn Middle-Game
description: IQP central themes: outposts, activity vs minority targeting.

name: Hanging Pawns Structure
description: c- and d-pawns advanced; dynamic piece play.

name: Closed Centre – French Chain
description: Demonstrates manoeuvring behind locked pawns.

name: Classic Minority Attack Setup
description: White rook on c1 preparing b4-b5 vs black c-pawn.

name: Opposite-Coloured Bishops Attack
description: Same-wing kings but bishops on opposite colours; emphasises initiative.

name: Good Knight vs Bad Bishop
description: Knight on outpost dominates own-pawn-blocked bishop.

name: Two Bishops vs Knight & Bishop
description: Demonstrates bishop-pair power on open board.

name: Queen Sacrifice – Pillsbury Mate Seed
description: Illustrates powerful queen sac followed by minor-piece mate.

name: Windmill Combination Start
description: Rook-bishop discovered check repeating.

name: Queen vs Rook Endgame – Philidor Position
description: Demonstrates winning technique with queen vs rook.

name: Reti Maneuver – Drawn King & Pawn
description: Famous zig-zag drawing method against outside pawn.

name: Underpromotion to Knight Mate
description: Shows why underpromoting to knight can be decisive.

name: Fortress – Rook vs Queen
description: Defensive setup where weaker side holds draw.

name: Bishop vs Wrong Rook Pawn
description: Demonstrates drawing idea with bishop that doesn't control promotion square.

name: Triangulation Opposition
description: King triangulates to gain zugzwang in pawn endgame.

name: Kingside Attack – H‐file Battery
description: Rook and queen doubled on h-file versus fianchetto king.

name: Queenside Majority – Passed a-Pawn
description: White aims to create outside passed pawn.

name: Good Bishop vs Bad Bishop
description: Active bishop outside own pawn chain dominates.

name: Domination – Knight Trap
description: Piece with no safe squares shows concept of domination.

name: Bishop Sacrifice on h7 – Template
description: 'Greek Gift' launching pad before Bxh7+.

name: Opposite-Side Castling – Pawn Storm Start
description: g-pawn already advanced; teaches timing of pawn pushes.

name: Bank Rank Weakness – Lift Created
description: Demonstrates creating luft with h3 to avoid back-rank mate.

name: Deflection – Overloaded Queen
description: Piece cannot defend two threats at once; forcing deflection.
